column1: Porsgrunn  is a city and municipality in Telemark in the county of Vestfold og Telemark in Norway. It is part of the traditional region of Grenland.  The administrative centre of the municipality is the city of Porsgrunn.

The municipality of Porsgrunn was established on 1 January 1838 (see formannskapsdistrikt).  The town of Brevik and the rural district of Eidanger were merged into the municipality of Porsgrunn on 1 January 1964.
The conurbation of Porsgrunn and Skien is considered by Statistics Norway to be the seventh-largest city in Norway.

column1: The coat of arms is from modern times.  They were granted on 16 January 1905.  The arms were devised in 1905 when the city needed a new city hall. The silver bend is the small river running through the city.  The upper half shows a silver-colored branch of bog myrtle on a red background and is thus a canting symbol. The silver anchor on a blue background symbolizes the importance of the local harbor.
Porsgrunn has been an important harbor town in the Grenland area since the late 16th century. In 1653
